snippet: The statistics represent some of the sharpest increases in enforcement under Police Commissioner William J. Bratton, who took office in January.
abstract: New York Police Department, under leadership of Commissioner William J Bratton, has begun ramping up arrests of panhandlers and peddlers in city's subway system; arrests have more than tripled over same period last year; under new administration, police continue to make fewer arrests and write fewer summonses, making increase in arrests of peddlers and panhandlers particularly striking.

byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and J. DAVID GOODMAN

lead_paragraph: The statistics represent some of the sharpest increases in enforcement under Police Commissioner William J. Bratton, who took office in January.

headline.main: Arrests of Panhandlers and Peddlers on Subways Triple Under Bratton
headline.print_headline: Arrests of Panhandlers and Peddlers on Subways Triple Under Bratton
